snippet: The Thompson brothers, Lyle and Miles, and their cousin, Ty, all Native Americans, are turning SUNY Albany into a lacrosse powerhouse.
abstract: Native American brothers Lyle and Miles Thompson, along with cousin Ty, have turned SUNY Albany into an unlikely lacrosse powerhouse; men, who grew up on a reservation in upstate New York, have become stars in a sport that was created by their ancestors, igniting a scramble for Native American recruits at lacrosse programs across the country.
lead_paragraph: The Thompson brothers, Lyle and Miles, and their cousin, Ty, all Native Americans, are turning SUNY Albany into a lacrosse powerhouse.

headline.seo: College Lacrosse Upended by Albany’s Native American Stars
headline.main: In a Native American Sport, a Family’s Giant Leap
headline.print_headline: In a Native American Sport, a Family’s Giant Leap

keywords.value: State University of New York at Albany
keywords.name: organizations
